metals.name: Bronze
metals.weapon_effect: Produces an audible chime when hitting a target, alerting creatures within 10 feet.
metals.description: A shiny brown-ish colored metal alloy of tin and copper, known for its resonance.

metals.name: Silver
metals.weapon_effect: Ignores some creature resistances, most notably were-creatures.
metals.description: A common precious metal often used to make coins, especially effective against shapechangers.

metals.name: Banglum
metals.weapon_effect: Deals 1d4 damage to each creature or object (non-held, non-worn) within 5 feet once per turn.
metals.description: A brown, unstable metal, theorized to be a lesser form of Scoria.

metals.name: Untempered Arandur
metals.description: A blue-green streaked metal appearing in hyaline glass pockets, refined to a silver-blue color.

metals.name: Cold Iron
metals.weapon_effect: Ignores resistances of fey creatures and deals an extra 1d4 damage.
metals.description: A precious metal mined in areas touched by dark magic, especially effective against fey.

metals.name: Ceramite
metals.weapon_effect: Bypasses same resistances as Adamantine, deals extra damage to objects.
metals.description: An alloy known as a ‘poor man’s adamantine’ with strong elemental resistance properties.

metals.name: Mithril
metals.weapon_effect: Weapons lose the heavy property or gain the light property; items weigh half as much.
metals.description: A silver-and-black mineral that becomes silvery-blue when forged, favored by dwarves.

metals.name: Magnetite
metals.weapon_effect: Functions as a compass; deals extra damage when pushing enemies.
metals.description: A natural lodestone, valuable to adventurers and navigators.

metals.name: Electrum
metals.description: A highly conductive dull blue metal, widely used for enchanting.

metals.name: Adamantine
metals.weapon_effect: Bypasses resistances; automatically crits on objects.
metals.description: A jet-black alloy of adamant with unique sheen depending on light source.

metals.name: Scoria
metals.weapon_effect: Deals extra fire damage on critical hits; causes fire damage on crit fails.
metals.description: A pulsating red-orange unstable metal, dangerous yet powerful.

metals.name: Auramite
metals.weapon_effect: Forces disadvantage on concentration saves; bypasses certain resistances.
metals.description: An alloy of meteoric ores and blessed metals, highly effective against extraplanar beings.

metals.name: Starfall Ore
metals.weapon_effect: Indestructible; gains attack bonuses at night and meteor showers.
metals.description: The rarest of the three star-born metals, desired by kings and demigods.
